Subjective: Irritated eye (rechter oog). Redness (rechter oog). Redness (linker oog, sinds gisteren). Feeling of something in the eye (rechter oog). No fever; no headache; no shortness of breath. Unable to play with daughter due to eye discomfort.
Objective: Vitals: normal. Physical Exam: redness (rechter oog); redness (linker oog); feeling of something in the eye (rechter oog). Pupils react normally.
Assessment: Ocular surface infection, likely viral. No signs of bacterial infection.
Plan: Use artificial tears to soothe the eye.
Monitor for signs of bacterial infection (pain, pus, discharge).
Return in 2 weeks if symptoms persist.
Call if symptoms worsen or if there are concerns.
